poem:
Title: In Vitro Verdict

Under the crimson cap of Alabama law,
within the glass hulls, life resides.
Stilled, the physicians seethe, 
in the crush of interpretation.
Beneath the grey shadow of gavel,
Embryos, transmuted to "extrauterine children".

Medicine, swallowed by misunderstanding,
howls futile against the ruling's chill.
The white tiles of the clinic,
now barren of the joy of creation.
Grief for those whose longing remains unfilled.
